original_theorem:
Suppose that $g$ is continuous at $x_0,$ $g(x_0)$ is an interior point
of $D_f,$ and $f$ is continuous at $g(x_0).$ Then
 $f\circ g$ is continuous at $x_0.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem continuous_comp_of_continuous_at {α β γ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] [TopologicalSpace γ]
  (f : β → γ) (g : α → β) (x₀ : α)
  (hg : ContinuousAt g x₀) (h_int : IsOpen (Set.range f)) (hf : ContinuousAt f (g x₀)) :
  ContinuousAt (f ∘ g) x₀ := by
```

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem continuous_comp_of_continuous_at {α β γ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] [TopologicalSpace γ]
  (f : β → γ) (g : α → β) (x₀ : α)
  (hg : ContinuousAt g x₀) (h_int : IsOpen (Set.range f)) (hf : ContinuousAt f (g x₀)) :
  ContinuousAt (f ∘ g) x₀ := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• $f$ is a function from a metric space $Y$ to a metric space $Z$ with domain $D_f \subseteq Y$, and $g(x_0)$ is an interior point of $D_f$ [tc_2].
• $f$ is continuous at $g(x_0)$ [tc_3].
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta_1 > 0$ such that for any point $t \in Y$, if $|t - g(x_0)| < \delta_1$, then $t \in D_f$ and $|f(t) - f(g(x_0))| < \epsilon$ [l1].

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem continuous_comp_of_continuous_at {α β γ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] [TopologicalSpace γ]
  (f : β → γ) (g : α → β) (x₀ : α)
  (hg : ContinuousAt g x₀) (h_int : IsOpen (Set.range f)) (hf : ContinuousAt f (g x₀)) :
  ContinuousAt (f ∘ g) x₀ := by
  have h_cont_at_f_domain : ∀ (U : Set γ), IsOpen U → f (g x₀) ∈ U →
    ∃ δ_1 > 0, ∀ (t : β), t ∈ Metric.ball (g x₀) δ_1 → t ∈ (f ⁻¹' U) := by
    apply (hf.continuousAt_iff_filter.mp hf).eventually
  sorry
